Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Las Vegas shooter Stephen Paddock did not die in 2013, as evidenced by the events that took place in 2017.
Understate: The claim understates the significance of the conspiracy theory surrounding the Las Vegas shooting and the alleged connection to the 2013 obituary.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the conspiracy theory, as it fails to provide evidence or a clear explanation of the alleged conspiracy.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that there can only be one person with the name "Stephen Paddock" at a time, disregarding the possibility of multiple individuals sharing the same name.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim suggests that there may be alternative explanations for the similarity in names, such as the Las Vegas shooter stealing the identity of the deceased individual from 2013.
